channel.title: [639 Dementhium] Webclient Invisibility
channel.description:
Could someone please explain or give me some suggestions on how to fix the invisibility issue.
This only seems to be happening on my computer, everyone else so far who is connecting to the server through the webclient CAN see items, only I cannot.
Any ideas or suggestions on a fix would be great.
EDIT: QUICK SOLUTION, Still have not found a fix for the webclient, but I have got my standalone working with the same quality settings and items are not invisible, this is what I was after all along. Would still like to hear a fix for the webclient though.
So if you have the same trouble, your webclient's items are invisible, and your standalones graphics are crap, change your clients run bat to: [code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javaw.exe" -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient servaddr 0.0.0.0 pause[/code]

item.title: [639 Dementhium] Webclient Invisibility
item.dc:creator: @RSMASTER RSMASTER
item.description:
@RSMASTER wrote:

Jar the root folder if using dementhium 639. I think the only reason I was having invisibility issues is because I was hosting the server and running the client on the same jdk. Using another bit version of jdk or using jre to run the client, fixes the invisibility problem.

Read full topic

item.title: [639 Dementhium] Webclient Invisibility
item.dc:creator: @wulliam wulliam
item.description:
@wulliam wrote:

I got a question for you and that’s how to put it online and make a .Jar because the client does’nt have a sign folder. and i dont understand what’s invisible.

Read full topic

item.title: [639 Dementhium] Webclient Invisibility
item.dc:creator: @RSMASTER RSMASTER
item.description:
@RSMASTER wrote:

Could someone please explain or give me some suggestions on how to fix the invisibility issue.

This only seems to be happening on my computer, everyone else so far who is connecting to the server through the webclient CAN see items, only I cannot.

Any ideas or suggestions on a fix would be great.

EDIT: QUICK SOLUTION, Still have not found a fix for the webclient, but I have got my standalone working with the same quality settings and items are not invisible, this is what I was after all along. Would still like to hear a fix for the webclient though.

So if you have the same trouble, your webclient’s items are invisible, and your standalones graphics are crap, change your clients run bat to:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javaw.exe" -cp asm-all-3.3.jar;clientlibs.jar; RunClient servaddr 0.0.0.0 pause
